result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (7th, 8th or 9th) and Operating w/ PAC (7th, 8th or 9th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (7th, 8th or 9th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (7th, 8th or 9th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Shannon L MOTT was found guilty of OWI (7th, 8th or 9th), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: The Court finds the defendant eligible for the Substance Abuse Program after serving the first eighteen (18) months of initial confinement.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Maintain absolute sobriety.

Provide DNA sample.

Intoxicated Driver Assessment and Driver Safety Plan.

Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 1 for trial.
ARRAIGNMENT - 
Information filed.  Copy served on defense counsel.
Not guilty pleas entered.  Jury calendar.
Settlement conference with District Attorney is set for 01-29-15 at 3:00 p.m.
MOTION TO MODIFY BAIL - 
Parties argue.
The Court grants the motion and modifies the bail to $2,500.00 recognizance bone with the following conditions:
- defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle;
- defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety;
- defendant is to report daily to the Manitowoc County Jail by 6:00 p.m. Jail personnel will be allowed to administer a PBT and if any alcohol is detected, the defendant will be arrested.  If the Brillion Police Department is willing to do this, it will be allowed.

The matter is continued for initial appearance on 01-05-15 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $2,500.00 cash with the conditions that he report to the Manitowoc City Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and other identifying information within 24 hours of release, that he maintain absolute sobriety and not operate a motor vehicle.
